meanings.definition: The point in the orbit of the moon or a satellite at which it is farthest from the earth.
meanings.sent1: During the rocket launch, the satellite reached its apogees, the farthest point from Earth.
meanings.sent2: The climber finally reached the apogees of the mountain after a long and challenging journey.
meanings.sent3: The cat's quest for the highest shelf in the house led to its apogees on top of the bookcase.
meanings.sent4: As the kite soared higher and higher, it seemed to touch the apogees of the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The balloon's flight took it to the apogees of the atmosphere, offering a breathtaking view of the landscape below.

meanings.sent1: The team's victory in the championship game was the apogees of their season.
meanings.sent2: Her performance at the concert reached its apogees with a standing ovation from the audience.
meanings.sent3: The chef's culinary skills reached their apogees when he prepared the perfect souffle.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece was considered the apogees of creativity in the modern art world.
meanings.sent5: The novel's thrilling conclusion was the apogees of the author's storytelling prowess.
